title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement jorteg01@ucb.ca. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.0, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/0/ code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https:// www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Contributing to ImgHelpR
text: outlines propose change ImgHelpR. detailed info contributing , tidyverse packages, please see development contributing guide.

title: Contributing to ImgHelpR
text: can fix typos, spelling mistakes, grammatical errors documentation directly using GitHub web interface, long changes made source file. generally means ’ll need edit roxygen2 comments .R, .Rd file. can find .R file generates .Rd reading comment first line.

title: Contributing to ImgHelpR
text: want make bigger change, ’s good idea first file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s needed. ’ve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal reprex (also help write unit test, needed).

title: Contributing to ImgHelpR
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("UBC-MDS/ImgHelpR", fork = TRUE). Install development dependencies devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md (.e. just first header). Follow style described https://style.tidyverse.org/news.html.

title: Contributing to ImgHelpR
text: New code follow tidyverse style guide. can use styler package apply styles, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases included easier accept.

title: Contributing to ImgHelpR
text: Please note ImgHelpR project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project agree abide terms.

title: ImgHelpR-vignette
text: explore basic image manipulation ImgHelpR, test image named ubc.jpeg provided. JPEG image needs read array; recommend using via jpeg::readJPEG('path') . display image,
code: # read image in via JPEG ubc <- jpeg::readJPEG('../test_img/ubc.jpeg') # display test image  plot(0:1,0:1,type='n',ann=FALSE,axes=FALSE) rasterImage(ubc, 0,0,1,1)

title: ImgHelpR-vignette
text: ImgHelpR comprised 4 main functions: Crop(img, width, height) function takes image desired height/width input, returns cropped image. ImgRotate(img, degree) function rotates image either 90, 180, 270, 360 degrees ’s original orientation. ColorConv(img, color) function converts image gray, red, green, blue. ImgCompress(img, method, level=1) function compresses image user-defined compression level.

title: ImgHelpR-vignette
text: Crop() cuts image’s dimensions desired size. three inputs, img, height, width must inputted user. function returns array, can read rasterImage shown Data section.
code: # display test image  plot(0:1,0:1,type='n',ann=FALSE,axes=FALSE) rasterImage(ubc, 0,0,1,1) # crop image cropped_ubc <- Crop(ubc, 300, 300) org_dim <- dim(ubc) crop_dim <- dim(cropped_ubc) # display cropped image plot(0:1,0:1,type='n',ann=FALSE,axes=FALSE) rasterImage(cropped_ubc, 0,0,1,1) # print current dimensions of test image print('Original dimensions: ')  #> [1] "Original dimensions: " org_dim #> [1] 400 400   3 print("Cropped dimensions: ") #> [1] "Cropped dimensions: " crop_dim #> [1] 300 300   3

title: ImgHelpR-vignette
text: ImgRotate() rotates image 90, 180, 270, 360 degrees counterclockwise. two inputs, img degree, must inputted user. function returns array, can read rasterImage shown Data section.
code: # display test image  plot(0:1,0:1,type='n',ann=FALSE,axes=FALSE) rasterImage(ubc, 0,0,1,1) # rotate image  ubc_180 <- ImgRotate(ubc, 180) # display rotated image plot(0:1,0:1,type='n',ann=FALSE,axes=FALSE) rasterImage(ubc_180, 0,0,1,1)

title: ImgHelpR-vignette
text: function converts image’s color gray, red, green, blue. two inputs, img color, must inputted user. function returns array, can read rasterImage shown Data section.
code: # display test image  plot(0:1,0:1,type='n',ann=FALSE,axes=FALSE) rasterImage(ubc, 0,0,1,1) # convert to gray  green_ubc <- ColorConv(ubc,color = "green") # display green image plot(0:1,0:1,type='n',ann=FALSE,axes=FALSE) rasterImage(green_ubc, 0,0,1,1)

title: ImgHelpR-vignette
text: function compress images user defined compression level. three inputs, img, method, level. method argument refers compression method, two options: method = "resize" method = "SVD". resize compresses via interval pixel selection method, SVD compresses via singular value decomposition. level refers level compression desired user, level 1 = High, 2 =Med, 3 = Low. function returns array, can read rasterImage shown Data section.
code: # display test image  plot(0:1,0:1,type='n',ann=FALSE,axes=FALSE) rasterImage(ubc, 0,0,1,1) # compress image  compress_ubc <- ImgCompress(ubc, method = "resize", level = 2) # display compressed image plot(0:1,0:1,type='n',ann=FALSE,axes=FALSE) rasterImage(compress_ubc, 0,0,1,1)

what: Tools to Help Process Image in R
title: Tools to Help Process Image in R
text: goal ImgHelpR simple R package help users crop, rotate, compress, change color scale given image. contains four functions: Crop(), ImgRotate(), ColorConv() ImgCompress() designed beginner-friendly image processing tool.

title: Tools to Help Process Image in R
Tools to Help Process Image in R
Tools to Help Process Image in R
text: Crop(img, width, height) function takes image desired height/width input, returns cropped image. image size cropped removing edge pixels input size reached. ImgRotate(img, degree) function rotates image either 90, 180, 270, 360 degrees ’s original orientation. image rotated pivoting array pixels desired degree. ColorConv(img, color) function converts image color specified user-input. image converted changing pixel values image’s array. ImgCompress(img, method, level=1) function compresses image user-defined compression level. compression methods supported function single value decomposition (SVD) simple image resize. Additionally, users can select compression levels desired (highest compression level = 1, lowest compression level = 2).

title: Tools to Help Process Image in R
text: examples use feature, check .

title: Tools to Help Process Image in R
text: one major image processing library already present R ecosystem. - Magick: Open source image processing package R based comprehensive ImageMagick STL. functions library comprehensive support wide range inputs, JPEG PDFs. Functionalities Magick vectorized, allowing quick image distortion. Magick covers image processing needs R, simple blurring drawing multi-frame graphics. aim ImgHelpR replace Magick – need reinvent wheel! intention ImgHelp beginner-friendly R library basic image manipulation. simple tool use need rotate, crop, compress, convert colors image.

title: Tools to Help Process Image in R
text: following people contributed creation ImgHelp: - Sufang Tan [@Kendy-Tan](https://github.com/Kendy-Tan) - Jasmine Ortega [@JasmineOrtega](https://github.com/jasmineortega) - Ho Kwan Lio [@stevenlio88](https://github.com/stevenlio88) - Maeve Shi [@MaeveShi](https://github.com/MaeveShi)

title: Image Compression — ImgCompress
text: SVD Method: SVD (Singular Value Decomposition) RGB image. Note: Actual image memory size changed function. handle Jpeg compression algorithm Resize: Resize image different size using interval pixel selection method.
